article_title: Japanese Judge a Witness to New Jersey Courts
article_text:
NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J.—At 27, Takuya Matsunami is a judge with years of experience in his native Japan. But in the New Jersey county courthouses where he now spends his time, he is something of an odd foreign wunderkind.

"The judges here are so old," Mr. Matsunami said, laughing. "They are experienced, and it helps to see that I could have that same level of experience."

Mr. Matsunami, unassuming and...

article_summary:

NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J.—At 27, Takuya Matsunami is a judge with years of experience in his native Japan.
"The judges here are so old," Mr. Matsunami said, laughing.
But in the New Jersey county courthouses where he now spends his time, he is something of an odd foreign wunderkind.
"They are experienced, and it helps to see that I could have that same level of experience."
